hypothesis_content.title: Volatility Compression Breakout with Regime Confirmation
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC's 10-day realized volatility falls below its 30-day realized volatility (compression) during a NEUTRAL regime, and the subsequent 4-hour candle closes above the Bollinger Band (20,2) upper band with volume > 20% above its 20-period average, a short-term volatility expansion and directional move will occur in the direction of the breakout.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Volatility compression in neutral markets often precedes expansion. The Bollinger Band squeeze combined with volume confirmation provides a high-probability breakout signal. Neutral regimes reduce false breakouts from pure momentum chasing.
entry_conditions: BTC 10D Realized Volatility < BTC 30D Realized Volatility (compression signal)
4H candle closes above BB(20,2) upper band

exit_conditions.take_profit: 7% price move from entry OR volatility ratio (10D/30D RV) crosses above 1.2
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Close below middle Bollinger Band (20 SMA) on 4H
exit_conditions.time_exit: 48 hours after entry if neither TP nor SL hit

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 55% of signals result in a failed breakout (price returns inside BB within 6 hours) OR average win rate < 52% over 100+ samples.
